title: Confession (May, 1937)
description:
Confession, May - 1937

***
AMG Summary: 

	German director Joe May brought a decidedly Teutonic ambience to his American film Confession--no surprise, since the film was based on the 1935 German production Mazurka. Kay Francis plays a onetime singer who confesses to the murder of her pianist, Basil Rathbone. In flashback, we learn that Rathbone had been responsible for the breakup of Francis's marriage.

(Revealing any more would spoil the movie. I guarantee you will never forget the last twenty minutes.)
